title: 3D Snake
affiliation: Major in Computer Science - Game Development, and a minor in Art & Design
biography: Jayden Sansom is a Computer Science major studying game development with an Art & Design minor. She aspires to work as a technical artist or director in the game industry, primarily focusing on shaders, materials, and textures!
short_description: It is the classic game you know and love, but in 3D!
long_description: Eat apples and grow big and strong without coiling yourself in a knot or falling off the edge! Enjoy a fun take on a retro game classic by exploring it in a new 3D world!
objective: Eat as many apples as possible, winning once you eat enough that the snake is finally full!
controls:
Space - Begin the game
Escape - Leave the game
Enter - Restart the game
W or Left - Move directionally to the left
D or Right - Move directionally to the right
mechanics: Instead of using a classic grid structure to move four ways, the movement is instead steering the head of the snake! Move with W and D or Left and Right to control the snake!
aesthetics: This game was made in a short amount of time, therefore, had to have quickly-produced models and textures. Even with the time limit, I aimed to create a cute take on the game while also having a low-poly feel. I hope that is creates a sense of familiarity of the classic while adding something new for the player!
background: This game was created for CSC461, Computer Graphics, as my final project. I was given the choice to work on a brick-breaker game but found that something unique was more my speed. I ended up working along, and as someone who usually works on game art, the gameplay programming was a challenge but I am happy with my results!
